TopicTitle: [1.2] PlanetShine - v0.2.5.2 stable - v0.5 experimental [4 October 2016]

Articles.Content:
I'm still playing with settings, looking for the best balance. Right now I haven't touched the ground ambient light... but then, I haven't been recording in the dark on the ground either. The vacuum light intensity I changed to .175 and that seems to work okay. Spacecraft are clearly visible in the recording, but night still looks dark. Playing around with it some more, it looks like you might bet away with settings as low as .125 or so, depending on what you're recording and what look you're trying for.

You think I should include alternate defaults for people who want to keep stock game brightness?

Has anyone considered actually darkening the nigh side ambient light on the surface? Right now, it just looks blankly FAR too light, maybe reduce it to around 0.2? Or better yet, make it configurable!

Has anyone considered actually darkening the nigh side ambient light on the surface? Right now, it just looks blankly FAR too light, maybe reduce it to around 0.2? Or better yet, make it configurable!

It's already the case in PlanetShine, but by default it's only overriding 50% of stock ground ambient light. Change the value of "Ground ambient light override" to 100% in the settings and you will get what you want.

I'm planning to make the night very dark on ground on next update, because there will be moonlight

That sounds great!

You are not supposed to literally replace the DLL of Ambient Light Adjustment, you just need uninstall it normally, and install PlanetShine normally. The way you did it, the mod was probably not working properly.

Sorry I was speaking in some kind of engineering shorthand. I did not do something like take the ambient DLL out and put yours in its place. That'd be dumb, yea. I renamed the ambient light DLL to not be a DLL so KSP would not load it (I do this all the time to test the removal of a DLL without actually deleting the file). I then installed PlanetShine in the normal copy-to-GameData way.

Anyway I think it was this:

V0.2.2 - 2014-10-20

- Included a custom planets/moons color file to use with the mod Real Solar System

- Vacuum ambient light level can now be set MUCH brighter

- New option in "CelestialBodies.cfg" to change the level of ground ambient overriding (I made it mostly for compatibility with RSS)

- Fixed some small typos and tweaked some calculations a bit

I was using 0.2.1 last time, and just tried again with this new version. It was much better. I can now remove ambient DLL entirely. Thanks!
